author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: A 32-year-old B.C. man has been charged by Hamilton police in connection to what authorities call “a complex cyber-enabled fraud.”  According to a July 9 press release from the Hamilton Police Service, the suspect is accused of taking advantage of a cyberattack in order to steal over half a million dollars from a municipal housing […]
title: BC Man Charged in $550,000 Cyber Fraud Targeting City of Hamilton

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Manitoba Premier Wab Kinew has declared another province-wide state of emergency due to the wildfires in the northern part of the province. “The primary reason that we have called this latest state of emergency is because we need access to more facilities to be able to shelter this large number of Manitobans who are being […]
title: Manitoba Premier Declares Provincewide State of Emergency Due to Wildfires

author: Lily Zhou
description: The bloc announced measures to coordinate essential goods among member states in crisis, and to boost the production of medical tools and critical chemicals.
title: EU to Stockpile Medical Supplies, Other Essential Goods in China De-risking Drive

author: Epoch Times Staff
description: A glimpse into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: Migrants in the English Channel, Beautiful Sailboats, and a Baby Pygmy Hippo

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Saskatchewan’s premier and mayors are demanding stronger bail laws from Ottawa, saying repeat violent offenders are making their communities dangerous. In addition to calling for bail reform at the July 9 press conference in North Battleford, Saskatchewan Premier Scott Moe said there needs to be stronger punishment for individuals trafficking meth and fentanyl in his province, […]
title: Sask. Premier, Mayors Push Ottawa to Strengthen Bail Laws

author: Chandra Philip
description: Transport Canada said it will align with a new U.S. policy that no longer requires passengers to remove their shoes during the airport security screening process. U.S. Secretary of Homeland Security Kristi Noem made the policy shift announcement on July 8, saying that she believed the change could be made while maintaining high security standards. […]
title: Canada Says It Will Align With US Changes That No Longer Require Travellers to Remove Shoes for Airport Security

author: Matthew Horwood
description: The last living feline from Parliament Hill’s famous cat colony, which operated from the 1970s until 2013, has passed away. Coal, a black cat that had been fighting salivary gland carcinoma since 2024, passed on July 8 after it became clear that his condition had become “grievous and irremediable,” his owner said. “Saying goodbye to […]
title: Last Cat From Parliament Hill’s Former ‘Cat Colony’ Passes Away

author: Frank Fang
description: It is unclear when Trump allegedly warned the two leaders.
title: Trump Allegedly Warned Putin, Xi That He Would Bomb Their Capitals: Report

author: Dorothy Li
description: The video-sharing app was fined $620 million in May for transferring European users' personal data to China, a ruling the company is appealing.
title: TikTok Faces 2nd Probe by EU Watchdog Over China Data Transfers

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Support for the Canadian military and the federal government’s increased defence spending is growing among Canadians, a new survey indicates. Canadians are increasingly expressing positive views of the Canadian Armed Forces (CAF) and their ability to defend the country, according to a new Abacus survey published July 9. The survey also indicated strong support among […]
title: Canadians Increasingly Support CAF, Defence Spending: Survey

author: The Canadian Press
description: Police in British Columbia are investigating after shots were fired at a restaurant linked to a prominent Indian comedian, with apparent footage of the overnight incident widely shared on social media. Kap’s Cafe is linked to comic and television host Kapil Sharma, who posted a video of the newly opened establishment on Instagram this week. […]
title: Shots Fired at Indian Star Kapil Sharma’s Surrey, BC, Restaurant

author: Chandra Philip
description: The Court of King’s Bench of Alberta has overturned the acquittal of a Calgary pastor in connection to his protests of drag story time events, and ordered a retrial in the Alberta Court of Justice. Pastor Derek Reimer was previously arrested and charged after protesting library drag queen story times for children between 2023 and […]
title: Calgary Court Overturns Acquittal of Pastor Charged After Drag Story Time Protest

author: Victoria Friedman
description: Ireland's Data Protection Commission said it remained concerned over accuracy of information provided by the company.
title: EU Opens Fresh Investigation Into TikTok Over Data Stored in China

author: Matthew Horwood
description: News Analysis The Conservatives had a short window this spring to re-establish their ground game in the House of Commons, but with the Liberals governing more from the right compared to before, the lack of a major issue to run with, and their leader’s absence in the House, it has arguably not been an easy […]
title: Have the Conservatives Found Their Messaging Following Their Election Loss?

author: Victoria Friedman
description: Yoon Suk Yeol will initially be incarcerated for up to 20 days, but this could mark a period of prolonged incarceration that could last months or even longer.
title: South Korean Court Approves New Arrest of Former President Yoon Over Martial Law Decree

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney’s new principal secretary is David Lametti, the former justice minister has confirmed. “Time to officially confirm a rumour that has been circulating for a while now: I have now joined the Prime Ministers team and on July 14 will assume the role of Principal Secretary to Prime Minister Mark Carney,” Lametti […]
title: Carney’s New Top Adviser Is Former Justice Minister David Lametti

author: James Xu
description: The flash floods hit Nepal on Tuesday due to the monsoon rains, washing away the Friendship Bridge connected to China.
title: Search Continues for 19 Missing After Flooding in Nepal

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Federal inspectors are set to give out record fines against Canadian employers who break the rules around migrant labour regulations, according to recently released figures. Inspectors have given out $3.7 million in fines in the first half of 2025 for numerous violations of the Temporary Foreign Worker Program, according to data from the federal immigration […]
title: Employer Fines for Breaches of Foreign Worker Rules on Track for Record Year

author: Guy Birchall
description: A report found that the British government was ill prepared to cope with the risk posed by the Islamic republic.
title: British Lawmakers Warn Iranian Threat to UK Is Significant and Rising

author: Ryan Morgan
description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio said he echoed Trump's growing frustration with the lack of progress in Ukraine–Russia peace talks.
title: Rubio Meets With Russia’s Lavrov Amid Trump’s Growing Frustration Over Ukraine Peace Process

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: The motion alleged that von der Leyen exchanged secret texts with Pfizer’s CEO, misused EU funds, and interfered in elections in Romania and Germany.
title: European Commission President Von der Leyen Survives Confidence Vote

author: Noé Chartier
description: The RCMP is clarifying remarks made by an officer discussing radicalization in a video clip that sparked controversy, with the police force headquarters saying it was not suggesting that someone with traditional values is an extremist. “The RCMP is in no way implying that embracing traditional values makes an individual radical or extreme,” spokesperson Marie-Eve […]
title: RCMP Clarifies Stance on ‘Traditional Values’ and Extremism

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: Czech government officials cite DeepSeek’s obligation to provide information to Beijing upon request as key concern.
title: Czech Republic Bans China’s DeepSeek Over Data Security Concerns

author: Owen Evans
description: EU leaders are pushing for investments in Ukraine as Russian missile strikes intensify and recovery costs soar past $500 billion.
title: Italy Hosts Conference on Rebuilding Ukraine as EU Pushes Public-Private Support

author: Guy Birchall
description: Three people have been killed and several are missing after the Yemeni terrorist group sank the second ship in a matter of days as they escalate their violence.
title: Rescue Underway After Latest Houthi Attack on Ship in Red Sea

author: Victoria Friedman
description: The pact comes amid a wider push for European nations to boost their defense spending and preparedness.
title: UK, France Agree to Nuclear Deterrence Pact to Defend Europe From Extreme Threats

author: Epoch Video
description: U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio participates in a memorandum of understanding signing ceremony with Malaysian Foreign Minister Mohamad Hasan at 7:50 a.m. ET on July 10 in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.
title: REPLAY: Rubio Participates in Memorandum of Understanding Ceremony With Malaysian Foreign Minister

author: Melanie Sun
description: President Nayib Bukele said accusations by Mexico's security minister that a plane carrying drugs departed from its territory were false.
title: El Salvador Recalls Ambassador to Mexico Over Drug Plane Allegations

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: The union's conduct has come in for harsh criticism from a senior lawyer asked to investigate, but remains registered.
title: Report Alleges CFMEU Used Intimidation Tactics to Silence Opposition

author: The Associated Press
description: Bruno, a 7-year-old, 88-kilogram (195-pound) bloodhound, was found dead in his shed in southern Taranto.
title: Italy Outraged at Killing of Police Bloodhound, Found Dead After Eating Food Laced With Nails

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: Liquidators and ASIC continue to investigate amid claims the failed company had purchased a luxury sports car.
title: Investors Owed up to $446 million in Superannuation Fund Collapse

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and the special envoy against anti-Semitism together released a new strategy outlining several recommendations.
title: Universities That Ignore Anti-Semitism Could Lose Federal Funds Under New Plan

author: Cindy Li
description: The prime minister will continue to advocate for Yang's interests and wellbeing, the prime minister's office said.
title: PM Pledges to Advocate for Yang Hengjun During China Visit, Silence on Persecuted Faith Group

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: Around 150 people will lose their jobs when the operation closes.
title: ‘Tough Day’: After 100 Years, Australia’s Largest Peanut Processor to Shut Down

author: Monica O’Shea
description: The position is one of the highest paid within the Australian Public Service.
title: PM’s New Climate Change Secretary to Earn $930,000 a Year

author: Nicole James
description: A throat balm in a tea cup.
title: The Ancient Herb That Clears Lungs and Soothes Irritated Throats

author: Jacob Burg
description: The special rapporteur is accused of abusing her position at the UN and for calling on the International Criminal Court to take action against Israel.
title: US Sanctions UN Expert Critical of Israel’s War in Gaza

author: Andrew Thornebrooke
description: The U.S. president is giving the green light to new weapons shipments to Ukraine and sanctions on Russia as negotiations with Moscow over its war stall.
title: Trump Is Losing Patience With Russia

author: Alfred Bui
description: 'It's critical to be able to talk about Beijing ... in a way that doesn't allow the issue to be turned back on those who raise it,' says one defence expert.
title: Analyst: ‘Racism’ Claims Are Muzzling CCP Interference Warnings—Exactly What Beijing Wants

author: Carolina Avendano
description: The Conservatives are calling on Ottawa to cancel a $1 billion loan the federal infrastructure bank is providing to BC Ferries for the purchase of four new vessels from a Chinese state-owned shipyard, saying the ships should be built in Canada to support domestic industries amid U.S. tariffs.  Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre announced his party’s […]
title: Conservatives Urge Ottawa to Cancel $1 Billion BC Ferries Loan for Chinese Shipyard Deal

author: Noé Chartier
description: Ottawa’s intention to turn to Europe to deepen defence ties amid uncertainty in the U.S. relationship could bring great economical benefits, but there is uncertainty around the feasibility and viability of the pact, a group of former top officials suggest in a white paper. Canada and the European Union (EU) announced the signing of a […]
title: Canada-EU Defence Deal Offers Promise but Fraught With Hurdles, Former Officials Say
